alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 05 at 6:17AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest Ohio, including the following county, Butler. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 616 AM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated that heavy rain had fallen due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Oxford, Monroe, Trenton, Ross, Seven Mile, Darrtown, Williamsdale, Dunlap, Reily, New Miami, Millville, Somerville, Jacksonburg, Mcgonigle, Collinsville, Layhigh and St. Charles.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
